p: Usually, RV-induced acute diarrhea is a significant cause of morbidity and mortality in piglets [ 14]. Previous studies showed that RV-infected pigs have reduced feed intake and weight loss compared to non-infected piglets [ 15, 16]. The pathology observed in virulent RV-infected in gnotobiotic pigs occurred primarily in intestinal villous epithelial cells with villous atrophy developing as a sequela to infection pathology [ 17]. Virus particles also can be observed in the small intestine epithelial cells in RV-infected piglets [ 18].
